Ltd, formed to manufacture and distribute instant noodles and other packaged food products across Nigeria and sub-Saharan Africa.The partnership combined Olam's extensive distribution network in Africa with Sanyo Foods' expertise in noodle technology and manufacturing.The company was a significant player in the Nigerian instant noodles market, known for its "Cherie" brand, which included products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Specialist

Job Location: Apapa, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

	Inspection & Testing: Examine raw materials, components, and finished products to ensure they meet quality standards.
	Process Monitoring: Monitor production lines to ensure operations are functioning correctly and adhere to guidelines.
	Documentation: Record inspection data (e.g., measurements, temperatures, defects) and generate detailed reports.
	Corrective Action: Identify, isolate, and report defective products or materials, and suggest improvements to production processes.
	Compliance & Standards: Ensure all items comply with internal policies, industry regulations, and safety standards.
	Equipment Maintenance: Calibrate and maintain testing instruments and equipment.


Job Qualifications


	Candidates should possess an HND or Bachelor's Degree with 5 - 10 years of experience.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:
Olam Sanyo Foods Limited,
53, Mobil Sidining Road,
Apapa, Lagos State.

title: Job Openings at Financial Institutions Training Centre
content:
Financial Institutions Training Centre (FITC) is a world-class, innovation-led, technology-driven, knowledge and professional services institute that provides cutting edge Learning, Advisory and Research Services to organizations primarily within the Financial Services Sector across Nigeria and sub-Saharan Africa.

We are recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) General Technician

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract
Directly reports to: Team Lead, Admin & Logistics

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The General Technician is responsible forthe routine maintenance, repair, and servicing of FITC’s office building and facilities.
	The role covers electrical works, mechanical support, and general facility upkeep, including lighting systems, air conditioners, fans, elevators, and related infrastructure.
	The position ensures a safe, functional, and conducive work environment for staff and visitors.


Facilities & Building Maintenance:


	Carry out routine inspection, maintenance, and repairs of office facilities, including lighting systems, fans, air conditioners, switches, sockets, and control panels.
	Replace faulty bulbs, fittings, switches, and electrical accessories promptly.
	Ensure proper functioning of elevators by reporting faults, supporting technicians, and monitoring repairs.


Electrical Works:


	Diagnose and fix electrical faults such as failed power supply, faulty wiring, and damaged electrical installations.
	Carry out minor electrical installations, rewiring, and adjustments in line with safety standards.
	Ensure compliance with electrical safety procedures and guidelines.


Equipment Servicing & Repairs:


	Support the servicing and basic maintenance of office equipment and utilities.
	Liaise with external technicians and service providers for specialized repairs and maintenance.
	Monitor functionality of generators, power supply points, and related infrastructure.


Preventive Maintenance:


	Conduct preventive maintenance activities to reduce equipment downtime and extend asset lifespan.
	Maintain maintenance schedules and promptly escalate major technical issues.


Health, Safety & Environment:


	Ensure a safe working environment by identifying and reporting hazards.
	Support compliance with workplace safety and facility management standards.


Documentation & Reporting:


	Maintain basic maintenance logs and records of repairs and servicing activities.
	Provide periodic updates to the line manager on facility conditions and maintenance needs.


Other Duties:


	Support office setup, rearrangement, and maintenance during relocations or renovations.
	Perform other duties as assigned by the Head of Corporate Services or Line Manager.


Requirements
Education Requirement:


	Technical School Certificate, OND, or equivalent qualification in Electrical Installation, Mechanical Works, or related field.


Experience:


	3 - 5 years of practical and hands-on experiencein facility maintenance, electrical works, or general technical services.


Technical Competencies:


	Electrical Maintenance & Repairs
	Facility & Building Maintenance
	Fault Diagnosis & Troubleshooting
	Preventive Maintenance Practices
	Basic Technical Documentation


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and a brief cover letter to: careers@fitc-ng.com using “General Technicians” as the subject of the application.

Note: That shortlisting will be on rolling basis, and only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

 

2.) Internal Audit & Compliance Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reporting Line: Head, Internal Audit & Compliance

Role Summary


	We are seeking a highly objective and detail-oriented Internal Audit & Compliance Officer to strengthen our risk management, control, and governance processes.
	The successful candidate will add value to the organisation by applying a systematic and disciplined approach to internal audit, compliance, and enterprise risk management, while ensuring financial reliability, operational effectiveness, and regulatory compliance.


Key Responsibilities


	Perform and manage the full internal audit cycle, including operational, financial, and compliance audits.
	Develop internal audit scope and contribute to the annual audit plan.
	Review and evaluate accounting records, processes, data, and prior audit reports.
	Prepare clear audit reports, findings memoranda, and recommendations for Management.
	Act as an independent and objective advisor to Management on risk, control, and governance matters.
	Identify control gaps, process weaknesses, and recommend risk mitigation and cost-saving measures.
	Conduct follow-up audits to monitor implementation of management actions.
	Plan, design, and implement enterprise-wide risk management processes.
	Conduct risk identification, assessment, evaluation, and reporting across the organisation.
	Support compliance audits and liaise with external auditors as required.
	Promote risk awareness through staff education, training, and advisory support.
	Maintain continuous professional development on audit standards, regulations, and best practices.


Requirements
Educational Qualification:


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or a related discipline.


Years of Experience:


	Minimum of 4–6 years of relevant experience in internal audit, compliance, risk management, or related roles, in a financial institution & financial service sector


Professional Certification (Required):


	ACA, ACCA, CIA, CISA, or any other relevant professional certification.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, audit standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Sound judgement, analytical thinking, and attention to detail.
	Excellent report writing, data analytics and presentation skills.
	Strong understanding of risk management frameworks and compliance practices.
	High level of integrity, objectivity, and professionalism.
	Ability to work independently and engage effectively with stakeholders at all levels.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and a brief cover letter to: careers@fitc-ng.com using “Internal Audit & Compliance Officer” as the subject of the mail.

Note: The applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and onlyshortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

 

3.) Team Lead, Strategy & Governance

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a highly skilled and results-driven Team Lead, Strategy & Governance to drive business growth, lead complex advisory engagements, and strengthen our governance and strategy offerings.


Role Overview


	The Team Lead, Strategy & Governance will be responsible for growing the Advisory business by identifying client needs, developing relevant products and services, and leading the execution of strategy, governance, and transformation projects.
	The role requires strong leadership, client engagement, and the ability to manage subject matter experts and consultants across multiple engagements.


Key Responsibilities


	Drive business development initiatives and expand FITC Advisory’s client portfolio.
	Lead strategy development and implementation engagements for clients.
	Deliver board evaluation, board recruitment, and board/strategy retreat assignments.
	Provide governance and strategy advisory services to boards, executives, and SMEs.
	Scope, plan, and oversee the delivery of strategy, governance, and transformation projects.
	Manage and coordinate subject matter experts and consultants to ensure high-quality delivery.
	Support clients on corporate transformation and organisational effectiveness initiatives.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field;Master’sdegree preferred.
	Minimum of 6 – 8years of work experience, with at least 5 years directly relevant to strategy, governance advisory, and team leadership.
	Proven experience leading strategy and governance engagements.
	Strong analytical, facilitation, proand stakeholder management skills.
	Demonstrated ability to grow advisory business and manage client relationships.


Key Competencies & Expertise:


	Corporate transformation and change management
	Strategy development and execution
	Brand and strategy audit
	Board and executive retreats facilitation
	Gap analysis and diagnostic assessments
	Reporting and Documentation
	Governance and strategy advisory
	Management and coordination of subject matter experts


Why Join FITC Advisory?


	Opportunity to work with boards and senior executives across sectors
	Exposure to high-impact strategy and governance projects
	A collaborative, professional, and growth-oriented environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and a brief cover letter detailing relevant experience to: careers@fitc-ng.com using “Team Lead, Strategy & Governance” as the subject of the application.

Note: The applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and onlyshortlisted candidates will be contacted    

    

        Click here to Apply

Sales Consultant - Logistix Job at Black Pelican Limited




        
    

        
        Black Pelican Group, established in 2004, is Nigeria’s foremost lifestyle solutions group and a leader in total interior solutions, providing end-to-end services through its subsidiaries – IL Bagno (premium luxury finishes), Bathrooms Direct (affordable sanitary wares, tiles, and doors), Bagno Technik (specialized installation and maintenance), BPL Logistix (integrated logistics, warehousing, and delivery), and BPL Wellness (fitness and wellness through an exclusive partnership with Technogym). With a strong reputation for excellence, we deliver world-class designs, products, and services that seamlessly cater to the luxury market, while upholding the highest standards of professionalism, innovation, continuous learning, and corporate social responsibility.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Consultant - Logistix

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Work Mode: Onsite

Role Overview


	The Sales Consultant is responsible for driving sustainable revenue growth for BP Logistix through aggressive business development, strategic account management, and solution-based selling of logistics services.
	The role requires a commercially astute professional who understands logistics operations, client pain points, and value-driven sales.


Key Responsibilities


	Drive revenue growth by identifying, prospecting, and converting new business opportunities for BP Logistix’s logistics and supply chain services, including haulage, freight, last-mile delivery, and warehousing solutions.
	Develop and maintain a strong sales pipeline through structured lead generation, client visits, networking, referrals, and strategic partnerships, ensuring consistent achievement of sales targets.
	Conduct in-depth client needs assessments to understand operational challenges and design tailored, value-driven logistics solutions that meet customer requirements and budgets.
	Prepare and present professional sales proposals, quotations, and service-level agreements (SLAs), and negotiate commercial terms in line with company policies and profitability objectives.
	Build and manage long-term relationships with clients, serving as the primary point of contact and ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction, retention, and repeat business.
	Collaborate closely with operations, customer service, and finance teams to ensure seamless service delivery and alignment between sales commitments and operational execution.
	Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer feedback to identify new sales opportunities, pricing strategies, and service improvement areas.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all sales activities, leads, and client interactions using approved CRM tools and internal reporting systems.
	Prepare and submit regular sales performance reports, forecasts, and pipeline updates to management, providing insights to support strategic decision-making.
	Represent BP Logistix professionally at all times, ensuring compliance with company policies, ethical standards, and regulatory requirements while safeguarding client and company information.


 Qualifications & Experience


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Logistics, Supply Chain, or related field.
	Minimum of 4–6 years of experience in sales or business development in the logistics sector.
	Proven ability to close deals and manage corporate clients.
	Strong understanding of logistics operations and pricing structures.
